text: おもちゃ一つ運ぶのに大層な護衛だよ / 太平洋艦隊勢ぞろいだから / な / 今の重要度を考えると足りないぐらいですが
translation: Such an elaborate escort for transporting a single toy. The entire Pacific Fleet has assembled, hasn't it? Considering its current importance, this still might not be enough.

vocabulary.meaning: level of importance, degree of significance

grammar: 〜に / で particle usage showing purpose/reason; 〜ぐらい expressing approximation

text: ではこの書類にサインを / まだだ / エヴァ2号機及び同操縦者は / ドイツの第三支部より本艦隊が預かっている / 君らの勝手は許さん
translation: Then please sign these documents. Not yet. Eva Unit 02 and its pilot are in the custody of this fleet from Germany's Third Branch. I won't allow you to do as you please.

vocabulary.meaning: to keep, to take custody of

grammar: 〜より indicating source/origin; 〜ている indicating current state; 許さん = 許さない (negative form, assertive tone)

text: ではいつ引き渡しを / 新横須賀に陸上げしてからになります
translation: Then when will the handover be? It will be after we land it at New Yokosuka.
grammar: 〜してから indicating 'after doing'; になります polite future expression

text: 海の上は我々の管轄だ / 黙って従ってもらおう / わかりました / ただし有事の際は我々ネルフの指揮権が / 最優先であることをお忘れなく
translation: The sea is our jurisdiction. You will silently comply. Understood. However, don't forget that in the event of an emergency, NERV's command authority takes top priority.
grammar: 〜てもらおう volitional form expressing intention to have someone do something; 〜の際 meaning 'in the event of'; お忘れなく = don't forget (polite imperative)

text: かっ / こえええ / 待って、リツコさんみたいだ / 相変わらず凛々しいな
translation: Cool! Wait, she's like Ritsuko. As dignified as ever.

vocabulary.meaning: cool, stylish (colloquially かっこええ in Kansai dialect)

grammar: 〜みたい expressing similarity ('like'); 相変わらず + adjective showing unchanged characteristics

text: カジ先輩 / だ / カ / ジ君、君をブリッジに招待した覚えはないぞ / それは失礼
translation: Kaji-senpai! Kaji-kun, I don't recall inviting you to the bridge. My apologies.
grammar: 〜した覚えはない expressing 'don't recall doing'; それは失礼 polite apology expression

text: これが / デートかいな / すごい、すごすぎる
translation: So this is the date, huh? Awesome, too awesome!

vocabulary.meaning: Kansai dialect particle expressing mild surprise/confirmation

grammar: かいな Kansai dialect ending particle; すぎる suffix indicating excess

text: シット、子供が世界を救うというのか / 時代が変わったのでしょう
translation: Shit, you're saying children will save the world? Times have changed, I suppose.
grammar: 〜というのか rhetorical question expressing disbelief; 〜のでしょう speculation/supposition

text: 議会もあのロボットに期待していると聞いてます / あんなおもちゃにかバカどもめ / そんな金があるんならこっちに回せばいいんだ
translation: I hear the council has high hopes for that robot. Those fools, putting faith in such a toy. If they have that kind of money, they should allocate it here.

vocabulary.meaning: to allocate, to divert, to send around

grammar: 〜と聞いている reporting hearsay; 〜んなら conditional 'if you have'; 〜ばいい suggesting what should be done

text: 何であんたがここにいるのよ彼 / 女の随伴でねドイツから出張さ復
translation: Why are you here? Escorting the girl, on business from Germany.
grammar: 何で expressing 'why'; 〜のよ feminine emphatic particle

text: 活だったわ十分考えられる地帯だったのにちょっと / 待ってよ / 仕方ないだろ
translation: It was active duty. It was an area where this was entirely possible. Hey, wait! It can't be helped.
grammar: 〜だったのに expressing regret/contrary expectation; 仕方ないだろ masculine explanatory tone

text: 今付き合ってるやついるの? / それがあなたに関係あるわけ / あれ?すれないな
translation: Are you seeing anyone now? How is that any of your business? Huh? You're being cold.

vocabulary.meaning: to date, to go out with
to be related, to have to do with

grammar: 〜てるやつ colloquial for 'person who is doing'; 〜わけ rhetorical question; すれない adjective meaning cold/aloof

text: 君はカツラギと同居してるんだって? / え、ええ / 彼女の目像の悪さ / 治ってる?
translation: I heard you're living with Katsuragi? Uh, yes. Has her terrible sleeping appearance improved any?
grammar: 〜んだって reporting hearsay (casual); 〜てる contracted form of 〜ている

text: な、な、な、な、なに言ってるのよ
translation: Wh-wh-what are you saying?!
grammar: Stuttering for emphasis/embarrassment; 〜てるのよ feminine emphatic progressive

text: 相変わらずか / イカリシンジ君 / ええ
translation: Same as ever, huh? Ikari Shinji-kun. Yes.
grammar: 〜か particle seeking confirmation

text: あれどうして僕の名前を / そりゃ知ってるさ
translation: Huh? How do you know my name? Of course I know.
grammar: そりゃ = それは (contraction); さ emphatic particle

text: この世界じゃ君は有名だからね / 何の訓練もなしにエヴァを実践で動かしたサードチルドレン
translation: You're famous in this world, you know. The Third Child who piloted an Eva in actual combat without any training.
grammar: 〜じゃ casual topic marker; 〜からね explanatory with emphasis; 何の〜もなしに without any

text: いやそんな偶然です / 偶然も運命の一部さ / 才能なんだよ君の / じゃまた後で / はい
translation: No, that was just coincidence. Coincidence is also part of destiny. It's your talent. See you later then. Yes.
grammar: 〜も also/even; 〜の一部 part of; 〜なんだよ explanatory emphasis; じゃ casual 'well then'

text: どう / だ / アンナ行こう!アンナのが選ばれたサードチルドレンだなんて厳密 / しかしいきなりの実践で彼のシンクロ率は40を軽く超えてるぞ / うそ! / しかし、イ
translation: What do you think? Let's go, Anna! That he's the chosen Third Child is... But in his first combat, his synch ratio easily exceeded 40! No way!
grammar: 〜なんて expressing surprise/disbelief; いきなりの modifying noun; 〜てるぞ emphatic progressive

text: ケスカン館長やったなあ / プライドの高い人なのよ、皮肉の一つも言いたくなるんでしょ
translation: The captain really got us good. He's a person with high pride, so he probably feels like saying a sarcastic remark or two.
grammar: やったなあ past tense with emphasis; 〜の一つも even one; 〜たくなる expressing desire/urge; んでしょ = のでしょう (speculation)

text: 賑やかで面白い人ですね、カジさん / 昔からなのよ、あのバカ / サードチルドレン!
translation: He's a lively and interesting person, isn't he, Kaji-san? He's been like that since the old days, that idiot. Third Child!
grammar: 〜で connecting two adjectives; 〜からなのよ explanatory feminine; あの demonstrative for familiar reference

text: ちょっと付き合って
translation: Come with me for a moment.
grammar: 〜て command form requesting action

text: 赤いんだ2号機って知らなかったな / 違うのはカラーリングだけじゃないわ
translation: So Unit 02 is red, I didn't know that. The color isn't the only difference.
grammar: 〜んだ explanatory tone; 〜って casual topic marker; 〜じゃない emphasizing negation

text: 所詮0号機と初号機は開発過程のプロトタイプとテストタイプ
translation: After all, Unit 00 and Unit 01 are just a prototype and test type from the development process.
grammar: 所詮 expressing dismissive attitude; と connecting two nouns

text: 訓練なしのあなたなんかにいきなりシンクロするのがそのいい証拠よ / けどこの2号機は違うわ
translation: The fact that someone like you with no training could suddenly synchronize is good proof of that. But this Unit 02 is different.
grammar: 〜なんか dismissive 'someone like'; 〜のが nominalizing the action; そのいい証拠 'good proof of that'; けど casual 'but'

text: これこそ実戦用に作られた世界初の本物のエヴァンゲリオンなのよ / 正式タイプのね
translation: This is the world's first real Evangelion made for actual combat. The official production type.
grammar: これこそ emphatic 'this precisely'; 〜用に for the purpose of; 〜作られた passive past 'was made'; 〜のよ feminine explanatory emphasis

text: なんだろう / 水中衝撃波
translation: What is that? Underwater shockwave.
grammar: 〜だろう speculation/wondering
